sen.j: 八幡前駅（はちまんまええき）は、京都市左京区にある叡山電鉄叡山電鉄鞍馬線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in the Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City, the Hachimanmae Station is a stop on the Kurama Line, the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Hachimanmae Station, located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, is a stop on the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Hachimanmae Station, located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, is a stop on the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ無人駅。
sen.e: An unmanned station with two platforms serving two tracks which face each other.
It's an unmanned station with two platforms serving two tracks that face each other.
It's an unmanned station with two platforms serving two tracks that face each other.

sen.j: 両ホームとも出町柳側・鞍馬側の南北両側に出入り口がある。
sen.e: Each platform has two entrances: one on the south side and another on the north side, on the Demachiyanagi side and on the Kurama side.
Each platform has two entrances: one on the south side (the Demachiyanagi side) and another on the north side (the Kurama side).
Each platform has two entrances: one on the south side (the Demachiyanagi side) and another on the north side (the Kurama side).

sen.j: 北側は一般道の踏切で、南側は駅構内踏切で両ホームを結んでいる。
sen.e: On the north side of the station is a level crossing on the open road; on the south side of the station is a crossing which links the platforms in the station.
On the north side of the station is a level crossing on the open road, while on the south side of the station is a crossing that links the station's platforms.
On the north side of the station is a level crossing on the open road, while on the south side of the station is a crossing that links the station's platforms.

sen.j: ホームをほぼすべて覆う上屋が設置されている。
sen.e: The roofs cover almost the entire platforms.
The roofs almost entirely cover the platforms.
The roofs almost entirely cover the platforms.

sen.j: また、駅名の由来となった近隣の三宅八幡宮に因み柵や上屋の柱は朱色に塗られている。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the fence and the columns supporting the roofs are painted in vermilion colors which have to do with the neighboring Miyake Hachimangu Shrine, from which the station name was originated.
Meanwhile, the fence and the columns supporting the roofs are painted in vermilion colors, which have to do with the neighboring Miyake Hachimangu Shrine from which the station's name originated.
Meanwhile, the fence and the columns supporting the roofs are painted in vermilion colors, which have to do with the neighboring Miyake Hachimangu Shrine from which the station's name originated.

sen.j: 上下共にバリアフリーには対応していない。
sen.e: Neither of the platforms (inbound or outbound line) is made barrier-free.
sen.cmt: 「上下共に」は「上りおよび下り線の両ホーム」と解釈し訳しました。
sen.e: Neither of the platforms (inbound or outbound line) is made barrier-free.
Neither of the platforms (inbound or outbound line) is made barrier-free.

sen.j: レール面からホーム面までの階段のみであるが（画像参照）車椅子等での利用には介護者が必要。
sen.e: From the track level to the platform level can be accessed only by stairs (refer to the image), and thus caretakers are needed for a person in wheel chairs.
Access from the track level to the platform level can be made only by way of stairs (refer to the image), so caretakers are needed for persons in wheelchairs.
Access from the track level to the platform level can be made only by way of stairs (refer to the image), so caretakers are needed for persons in wheelchairs.

sen.j: 住宅街にあり、京都府道105号岩倉山端線から一般道を西へ数10ｍ入った所。
sen.e: The station is located in the residential area, several tens of meters to the west of the open road from the Iwakura-Yamabanasen Kyoto Fudo 105 Go (Kyoto Prefecture Road 105).
The station is located in a residential area several tens of meters to the west of the open road from the Iwakura-Yamabanasen Kyoto Fudo 105 Go (Kyoto Prefecture Road 105).
The station is located in a residential area several tens of meters to the west of the open road from the Iwakura-Yamabana Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 105.
sen.cmt: 京都府道105号岩倉山端線→Iwakura-Yamabana Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 105

sen.j: 同志社高等学校
sen.e: Doshisha High School
Doshisha High School
Doshisha High School

sen.j: 三宅八幡宮
sen.e: Miyake Hachimangu Shrine
Miyake Hachimangu Shrine
Miyake Hachimangu Shrine

sen.j: 京都銀行三宅八幡支店
sen.e: Miyakehachiman Branch, Bank of Kyoto
Miyakehachiman Branch, Bank of Kyoto
Miyakehachiman Branch, Bank of Kyoto

sen.j: 岸本書店（回数券委託発売所）
sen.e: Kishimoto Shoten (Bookstore) (Commutation tickets are sold on comission.)
The Kishimoto Shoten bookstore sells commuter tickets on commission.
Kishimoto Shoten Bookstore (commuter tickets sold on commission)

sen.j: バスのりば
sen.e: Bus stop
Bus stop
Bus stop

sen.j: 八幡前（駅から府道に出た所にある）
sen.e: Hachimanmae (The bus stop is located on the Prefecture Road near the station.)
Hachimanmae, a bus stop located on the Prefecture Road near the station
Hachimanmae (a bus stop located on the Prefectural Route near the station)
sen.cmt: 京都府道→Kyoto Prefectural Route としました。

sen.j: 京都バス
sen.e: Kyoto Bus
Kyoto Bus
Kyoto Bus

sen.j: 南行き・・・国際会館駅、北大路駅、出町柳駅、四条河原町、京都駅方面、北行き・・・岩倉実相院、岩倉村松、方面
sen.e: Southbound・・・bound for Kokusaikaikan Station, Kitaoji Station, Demachiyanagi Station, Shijo-Kawaramachi, and Kyoto Station: northbound・・・bound for Jissoin Temple abd Iwakura Muramatsu
sen.cmt: 「・・・」は訳文にもそのまま反映しました。
sen.e: Southbound・・・bound for Kokusai-kaikan Station, Kitaoji Station, Demachiyanagi Station, Shijo-Kawaramachi and Kyoto Station: northbound・・・bound for Jissoin Temple and Iwakura Muramatsu
Southbound・・・bound for Kokusai-kaikan Station, Kitaoji Station, Demachiyanagi Station, Shijo-Kawaramachi and Kyoto Station: northbound・・・bound for Jissoin Temple and Iwakura Muramatsu

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）12月1日 鞍馬電気鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: The station opened on December 1, 1928, as a station owned by the Kurama Electric Railway.
The station opened on December 1, 1928 under the ownership of the Kurama Electric Railway.
December 1, 1928: The station opened under the ownership of the Kurama Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）8月1日 会社合併により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On August 1, 1942, the station came to be owned by the Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of amalgamation.
On August 1, 1942 the station came under the ownership of the Keifuku Electric Railroad due to the amalgamation.
August 1, 1942: The station came under the ownership of the Keifuku Electric Railroad due to the amalgamation.

sen.j: 1944年（昭和19年）11月10日 当駅を含む、山端（現・宝ヶ池駅）～二軒茶屋駅 (京都府)間が、戦争に伴う資材供出のため単線化。
sen.e: On November 10, 1944, the line between the Yamabana Station (currently called Takaragaike Station) and the Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), including the Hachimanmae Station, became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

On November 10, 1944 the line between Yamabana Station (currently Takaragaike Station) and the Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), including Hachimanmae Station, became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

November 10, 1944: The line between Yamabana Station (currently Takaragaike Station) and the Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), including Hachimanmae Station, became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

sen.j: 1958年（昭和33年）4月9日 宝ヶ池～岩倉駅 (京都府)間が再複線化。
sen.e: On April 9, 1958, the line between the Takaragaike Station and the Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became a double track again.
On April 9, 1958 the line between Takaragaike Station and Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became a double track again.
April 9, 1958: The line between Takaragaike Station and Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became a double track again.

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）4月1日 会社再編により叡山電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1986, the station came to be owned by the Eizan Electric Railway as a result of reorganization of companies.
On April 1, 1986, the station came under the ownership of the Eizan Electric Railway due to the reorganization of companies.
April 1, 1986: The station came under the ownership of the Eizan Electric Railway due to the reorganization of companies.

sen.j: 叡山電鉄
sen.e: Eizan Electric Railway
Eizan Electric Railway
Eizan Electric Railway

sen.j: 鞍馬線
sen.e: Kurama Line
Kurama Line

sen.j: 宝ヶ池駅 - 八幡前駅 - 岩倉駅 (京都府)
sen.e: Takaragaike Station - Hachimanmae Station - Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture)
